definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Above all, an authoritarian state intolerant of dissent and a one-party political system.
sentences.chinese: 专制国家偏执地使用一党专制的政治制度。

sentences.english: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
sentences.chinese: 地裂开，吞下大坍，掩盖亚比兰一党的人。

sentences.english: Or is he promoting limited internal reforms designed to strengthen one-party rule?
sentences.chinese: 抑或他是在推动旨在加强一党统治的有限内部改革？

sentences.english: Hard to do with a one-party democracy.
sentences.chinese: 这是一党民主难以做到的。

sentences.english: It's not wise to put that money under one-party control.
sentences.chinese: 把所有的钱都让一党控制的做法很不明智。

sentences.english: His party won the election with a big majority.
sentences.chinese: 他那一党以高票赢得了选举。

sentences.english: This do; Take you censers, Korah, and all his company;
sentences.chinese: 可拉阿，你们要这样行，你和你的一党要拿香炉来。

sentences.english: for they be all adulterers, an assembly of treacherous men.
sentences.chinese: 因他们都是行奸淫的，是行诡诈的一党。

definition: to betray one's party/to defect (from the communist party)/renegade faction
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
member of the same party/member of the same group/accomplice
to overthrow/downfall/to fall from power/to go bankrupt
